intro: Lastrea multiseta, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, needle-like leaves and produces clusters of bell-shaped, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is appreciated in both horticulture and conservation efforts.
